comments.author: KaosanRoad
comments.body: Hello OP i dont want to be rude, but you should listen to the long-term users and read before you apply. Newbies dont get a loan and that is totally understandable.I would also do the same and I understand the rules. Nobody would give away their money and "maybe" get money back.No collateral = No loan as a newbie.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: gpbit57 on July 10, 2023, 12:09:41 AMI've been dealing with cryptocurrencies for a long time now, I wouldn't be here asking for a loan if I really didn't need it, it's an emergency.So after almost 7 years in the forum with no single post, zero reputation and interactions with other forum members, you thought to yourself that it was wise to ask for a no collateral loan?Even if you registered in 2015, your account rank is no different from a newbie that registered in 2023. Dealing with cryptocurrencies for long does than guarantee that you will pay the loan back.
